Comments_List: This course teaches mechanics in 3D and this is how you learn how to deal with complexities of 3D motion and be able to solve problems. Dynamics helps you explore the causes of motion and analyze forces acting on different bodies and the properties of the bodies, particularly moment of inertia. The class prepares you for Celestial mechanics and other classical mechanics branches. You would also learn how to write/modify code in MATLAB which is a good preparation for learning Statistical mechanics and helps you explore different research endeavors in Mechanical Engineering.
Knowledge of dynamics, the physical study of bodies in motion (it's like physics but harder)

A very good course.
Only one weakness is that we did not have enough time to dive deeply into some topics and engage in solving more Dynamics problems.
Good but disorganized. Hard to study, some homeworks were Matlab based, but tests were not

The pace of summer classes can be jarring and in general, it was hard to see the broader picture of dynamics while trying to keep up with the problems in the immediate. The strengths were definitely the amount of interaction between all the students, Corey, and Aya.

If you are a mechanical engineering major (ABET) you need to take this course. You would enjoy it if you really enjoy learning something at the intersection of vector calculus, differential equations, linear algebra, physics and classical mechanics.
I don't think anyone would take this course if it wasn't required
